skill.name: web3-testing
skill.description: Test smart contracts comprehensively using Hardhat and Foundry with unit tests, integration tests, and mainnet forking. Use when testing Solidity contracts, setting up blockchain test suites, or validating DeFi protocols.
skill.summary: Test smart contracts comprehensively using Hardhat and Foundry with unit tests, integration tests, a...

security_audit.summary: No data theft, exfiltration, or malicious execution patterns detected. Content is instructional and limited to testing workflows and configuration examples.

content.value_statement: Smart contracts fail when test coverage is shallow and edge cases are missed. This skill guides you through Hardhat and Foundry tests with forking and fuzzing.
actual_capabilities: Provide Hardhat configuration with forking, gas reporter, and Etherscan settings
Outline unit and integration test patterns using Hardhat helpers
Show Foundry test structure with cheatcodes and fuzzing
Describe mainnet forking workflows for realistic testing
Explain gas usage comparisons and coverage reporting steps
limitations: Does not execute tests or install dependencies
Requires user provided RPC URLs and API keys
Does not perform formal security audits of contracts
Does not deploy contracts to live networks

use_cases.title: Create unit test suites
use_cases.description: Design unit tests for token and protocol logic using Hardhat and Foundry patterns.

use_cases.title: Validate mainnet behavior
use_cases.description: Plan fork based tests to simulate swaps and liquidity interactions safely.

use_cases.title: Standardize CI testing
use_cases.description: Define coverage and gas reporting steps for continuous integration.

prompt_templates.title: Start with unit tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a simple Hardhat unit test plan for a basic ERC20 token with owner checks and transfer failures.

prompt_templates.title: Add integration tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline integration tests for a protocol with vault and strategy contracts, including setup fixtures and event checks.

prompt_templates.title: Use mainnet forking
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a mainnet forking test outline to validate a Uniswap swap path and handle token decimals safely.

prompt_templates.title: Apply fuzzing and gas checks
prompt_templates.prompt: Design Foundry fuzz tests for transfer limits and add gas comparison checks between optimized and baseline functions.

output_examples.input: Draft a testing checklist for a lending protocol using Hardhat and Foundry.
output: Unit tests for access control, collateral ratios, and repayment math
Integration tests with mocked price feeds and liquidation flows
Mainnet fork test for a real asset pair
Fuzzing for borrow and repay edge cases
Gas benchmarks for deposit and withdraw paths

best_practices: Use fixtures to keep tests deterministic and fast
Validate events and revert reasons for key actions
Run coverage and gas reports on every change
anti_patterns: Testing only happy paths without failure cases
Relying on live networks for routine tests
Skipping fuzzing for user input functions

faq.question: Which frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: It focuses on Hardhat and Foundry testing patterns for Solidity contracts.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance only and does not run tests or manage dependencies.

faq.question: Can it fit into CI pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, it outlines coverage and test commands suitable for CI workflows.

faq.question: Does it access wallets or private keys?
faq.answer: No, it only references environment variables in examples.

faq.question: What if tests fail to run locally?
faq.answer: Check framework installation, RPC URLs, and network configuration first.

faq.question: How is this different from a general test guide?
faq.answer: It is tailored to smart contract testing with Hardhat and Foundry.
